quote: Earth has no sorrow that Heaven cannot heal.
A feeling of sadness and longing that is not akin to pain, and resembles sorrow only as the mist resembles the rain.
A sorrow's crown of sorrow is remembering happier times.
Bear and endure: This sorrow will one day prove to be for your good.
Can I see another's woe, and not be in sorrow too? Can I see another's grief, and not seek for kind relief?
Excessive sorrow laughs. Excessive joy weeps.
Excessive sorrow laughs. Excessive joy weeps.
I hold it true, whatever befall;
Earth has no sorrow that Heaven cannot heal.
A feeling of sadness and longing that is not akin to pain, and resembles sorrow only as the mist resembles the rain.
A sorrow's crown of sorrow is remembering happier times.
Bear and endure: This sorrow will one day prove to be for your good.
Can I see another's woe, and not be in sorrow too? Can I see another's grief, and not seek for kind relief?
Excessive sorrow laughs. Excessive joy weeps.
Excessive sorrow laughs. Excessive joy weeps.
I hold it true, whatever befall;
It has been said that our anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrow, but only empties today of its strength.
It is foolish to tear one's hair in grief, as though sorrow would be made less with baldness.
It is only in sorrow bad weather masters us; in joy we face the storm and defy it.
It seldom happens that any felicity comes so pure as not to be tempered and allayed by some mixture of sorrow.
Labour without joy is base. Labour without sorrow is base. Sorrow without labour is base. Joy without labour is base.
Never allow your own sorrow to absorb you, but seek out another to console, and you will find consolation.
Not enjoyment and not sorrow, is our destined end or way; but to act that each tomorrow find us farther than today.
Not enjoyment, and not sorrow is our destined way, but to act that each tomorrow may find us further than today.
Old age is not a matter for sorrow. It is matter for thanks if we have left our work done behind us.
One can endure sorrow alone, but it takes two to be glad.
Parting is such sweet sorrow.
Patience is a remedy for every sorrow.
Renunciation remains sorrow, though a sorrow borne willingly.
Shame on those breasts of stone that cannot melt in soft adoption of another's sorrow.
Sorrow has produced more melody than mirth.
Sorrow is easy to express and so hard to tell.
Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
Sorrow is the great idealizer.
Sorrow is the rust of the soul and activity will cleanse and brighten it.
Sorrow is tranquility remembered in emotion.
Sorrow makes us all children again, destroys all differences of intellect. The wisest knows nothing.
The busy bee has no time for sorrow.
The craving for sympathy is the common boundary-line between joy and sorrow.
The cure for sorrow is to learn something.
The natural effect of sorrow over the dead is to refine and elevate the mind.
The path of sorrow and that path alone, leads to a land where sorrow is unknown.
The pleasure that is in sorrow is sweeter than the pleasure of pleasure itself.
The pleasure that is in sorrow is sweeter than the pleasure of pleasure itself.
The rose and the thorn, and sorrow and gladness are linked together.
The secret source of humor itself is not joy but sorrow. There is no humor in heaven.
There are times when sorrow seems to be the only truth.
There are times when sorrow seems to me to be the only truth.
There is no corner too quiet, or too far away, for a woman to make sorrow in it.
There is no greater sorrow than to recall happiness in times of misery.
There is no worse sorrow than remembering happiness in the day of sorrow.
There is pleasure in calm remembrance of a past sorrow.
There is something in sorrow more akin to the course of human affairs than joy.
There's no such thing as old age, there is only sorrow.
They say my verse is sad: no wonder.
To have gold is to be in fear, and to want it to be sorrow.
Two thirds of all sorrow is homemade and, so far as the universe is concerned, unnecessary.
We should feel sorrow, but not sink under its oppression.
Where there is sorrow there is holy ground.
Worry does not empty tomorrow of its sorrow; it empties today of its strength.
Worrying doesn't empty tomorrow of its sorrow, it empties today of its strength.
Good night, good night! Parting is such sweet sorrow, that I shall say: Good night, till it be morrow.
